text: I'm a cloud computing option head and an
instructor with the school of computing
and academic studies at British
Columbians through their technology or
BCIT in our department we school of
computing we have two two-year diploma
programs one of the diplomas is focused
on students that want to be software
developers and the others focused on
students that want to be systems
administrators they don't want a program
that they want to be involved in
installing systems networking and things
like that we also have a small Bachelor
of Technology program in total we have
we take in about 350 students every year
and so we're running about 700
concurrent students in these three
programs so most of the students that
come to take our computing programs want
to get hands-on technical skills as
quickly as possible they already come
knowing a good idea what they want to do
career-wise
they don't want to take a lot of extra
courses and they really want to learn to
program or build systems and then get
jobs in the local local tech industries
so about five years ago we really
realized that having a cloud computing
course in our curriculum was going to be
very important because we saw where
Amazon Web Services were going and we
knew this was going to be a future for a
lot of companies even though the
companies at the time didn't realize it
so a TFIOS educate makes it really easy
for students to enroll and get access to
the AWS platform through the credits are
really amazing I think we've all been in
the situation where we graduate from
college and we start applying for our
first jobs and a lot of times employers
say what experience do you have and with
our program all of the students can put
at least two and that they've worked on
two real-world projects with different
companies I think AWS educated it makes
it really easy for professors like
myself to get on to the cloud there's so
many resources at AWS
educate has online good lap materials
really good documentation and I think
it's really up to them as to say what
kind of skill AWS skills do we want to
teach our students but it's it for me it
was really easy to enroll myself and
there was enough material and labs that
I could easily build quite a bit of my
curriculum simply from the sample
materials that were available online
[Music]
